moves.1. d4: WATCH ME PLAY STUPIDLY!  I play this about half the time
moves.1... d5 2. c4 h6: bg5 is not something I usually play anyway
moves.3... Nf6 4. cxd5: I figure i can push his knight around while developing
moves.4... Nxd5 5. e4 Nf6 6. e5 Nd5 7. Bc4: and it works fairly well. I have my piece established and he is busy moving his knight
moves.7... Nb6 8. Qb3: possibly a mistake but also threatens bf7+ which leads to kd7 and hten maybe e6+ putting the pawn in a powerful well-protected position
moves.9. Be3: wanted more backup on d4 pawn, better than bf4 i think because d4 pawn make move while e5 pawn wont. Maybe bd2 would have been better or nc3
moves.9... a6 10. O-O Nc6 11. a3: I though he was going to b4 but I missed the trap that followed
moves.11... Na5: threatens queen which stops me from bringing an additional defender to bishop
moves.12. Bb5+: Knowing that the bishop is doomed I figure that I can atleast get a pawn out of it
moves.12... c6: Chooses not to take. A mistake I think because instead of losing the a pawn black loses the b pawn
moves.13. Bxc6+ bxc6 14. Qc2 Nd5 15. b4: pushing the knight away from protecting c6
White has mate if black gives me a turn...
